title: Sparse Numeric Vectors
text: sparse package provides sparse_numeric class representation fo sparse numeric vector. class comes associated helper methods operations vectors addition, multiplication, etc…

title: Sparse Numeric Vectors
text: construct sparse vector, can convert dense vector sparse like . Now sparse vector can perform basic arithmetic operations addition, multiplication, subtraction. also define helpers inner product, mean, standardization. Finally can print visualize sparse vectors.
code: library(sparse) #>  #> Attaching package: 'sparse' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     norm  dense1 <- c(1, rep(0, 1e7)) dense2 <- c( rep(0, 1e7), 1) sparse1 <- as(dense1, "sparse_numeric") sparse2 <- as(dense2, "sparse_numeric") sparse1 - sparse2 #> Sparse numeric vector of length 10000001 with 2 non-zero entries #> Positions: 1 10000001  #> Values:    1 -1 sparse1 + sparse2 #> Sparse numeric vector of length 10000001 with 2 non-zero entries #> Positions: 1 10000001  #> Values:    1 1 sparse1 * sparse2 #> Sparse numeric vector of length 10000001 with 0 non-zero entries #> Positions:   #> Values: sparse_crossprod(sparse1, sparse2) #> [1] 0 mean(sparse1) #> [1] 9.999999e-08 s <- standardize(sparse1) show(sparse1) #> Sparse numeric vector of length 10000001 with 1 non-zero entries #> Positions: 1  #> Values:    1 plot(sparse1, sparse2)
